field.name: summary
field.value: DefaultUrlTokenizer leaves sub domain on domain causing DefaultUrlBuilder to build incorrect URLs

field.name: description
field.value:
DefaultUrlTokenizer had code commented out to remove the subdomain from the domain, which should happen if the DefaultUrlBuilder is going to look at subdomains when building URLs. This has the side effect of the subdomain always being parsed when it maybe should have been. for example castleproject.org will be subdomain=castproject domain=org or castleproject.co.uk being parsed as subdomain=castleproject, domain=co.uk.
The DefaultUrlBuilder now correctly rebuilds these URLs however. Before creating an absolution path url using the current urlinfo would result in the subdomain being in the URL twice, like www.www.castleproject.org.
The patch includes new tests for testing this while keeping the other tests passing.
Patch file created on the MonoRail folder
